description: Creates a stack to start streaming applications to users. A stack consists of an associated fleet, user access policies, and storage configurations.

parameters.name: StorageConnectors
parameters.description: The storage connectors to enable. (dict) --- Describes a connector that enables persistent storage for users. The type of storage connector. ResourceIdentifier (string) --- The ARN of the storage connector. Domains (list) --- The names of the domains for the account. (string) --- GSuite domain for GDrive integration. DomainsRequireAdminConsent (list) --- The OneDrive for Business domains where you require admin consent when users try to link their OneDrive account to AppStream 2.0. The attribute can only be specified when ConnectorType=ONE_DRIVE. (string) --- GSuite domain for GDrive integration.

nested_params.name: ResourceIdentifier
nested_params.description: The ARN of the storage connector.

nested_params.name: Domains
nested_params.description: The names of the domains for the account.

nested_params.name: DomainsRequireAdminConsent
nested_params.description: The OneDrive for Business domains where you require admin consent when users try to link their OneDrive account to AppStream 2.0. The attribute can only be specified when ConnectorType=ONE_DRIVE.

parameters.name: UserSettings
parameters.description: The actions that are enabled or disabled for users during their streaming sessions. By default, these actions are enabled. (dict) --- Describes an action and whether the action is enabled or disabled for users during their streaming sessions. The action that is enabled or disabled. Indicates whether the action is enabled or disabled. MaximumLength (integer) --- Specifies the number of characters that can be copied by end users from the local device to the remote session, and to the local device from the remote session. This can be specified only for the CLIPBOARD_COPY_FROM_LOCAL_DEVICE and CLIPBOARD_COPY_TO_LOCAL_DEVICE actions. This defaults to 20,971,520 (20 MB) when unspecified and the permission is ENABLED. This can't be specified when the permission is DISABLED. The value can be between 1 and 20,971,520 (20 MB).

nested_params.name: Action
nested_params.description: The action that is enabled or disabled.

nested_params.name: Permission
nested_params.description: Indicates whether the action is enabled or disabled.

nested_params.name: MaximumLength
nested_params.description: Specifies the number of characters that can be copied by end users from the local device to the remote session, and to the local device from the remote session. This can be specified only for the CLIPBOARD_COPY_FROM_LOCAL_DEVICE and CLIPBOARD_COPY_TO_LOCAL_DEVICE actions. This defaults to 20,971,520 (20 MB) when unspecified and the permission is ENABLED. This can't be specified when the permission is DISABLED. The value can be between 1 and 20,971,520 (20 MB).

parameters.name: ApplicationSettings
parameters.description: The persistent application settings for users of a stack. When these settings are enabled, changes that users make to applications and Windows settings are automatically saved after each session and applied to the next session. Enables or disables persistent application settings for users during their streaming sessions. SettingsGroup (string) --- The path prefix for the S3 bucket where users' persistent application settings are stored. You can allow the same persistent application settings to be used across multiple stacks by specifying the same settings group for each stack.

nested_params.name: Enabled
nested_params.description: Enables or disables persistent application settings for users during their streaming sessions.

nested_params.name: SettingsGroup
nested_params.description: The path prefix for the S3 bucket where users' persistent application settings are stored. You can allow the same persistent application settings to be used across multiple stacks by specifying the same settings group for each stack.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to associate with the stack. A tag is a key-value pair, and the value is optional. For example, Environment=Test. If you do not specify a value, Environment=. If you do not specify a value, the value is set to an empty string. Generally allowed characters are: letters, numbers, and spaces representable in UTF-8, and the following special characters: _ . : / = + - @ For more information about tags, see Tagging Your Resources in the Amazon AppStream 2.0 Administration Guide. (string) --- (string) ---

parameters.name: AccessEndpoints
parameters.description: The list of interface VPC endpoint (interface endpoint) objects. Users of the stack can connect to AppStream 2.0 only through the specified endpoints. (dict) --- Describes an interface VPC endpoint (interface endpoint) that lets you create a private connection between the virtual private cloud (VPC) that you specify and AppStream 2.0. When you specify an interface endpoint for a stack, users of the stack can connect to AppStream 2.0 only through that endpoint. When you specify an interface endpoint for an image builder, administrators can connect to the image builder only through that endpoint. The type of interface endpoint. VpceId (string) --- The identifier (ID) of the VPC in which the interface endpoint is used.

nested_params.name: VpceId
nested_params.description: The identifier (ID) of the VPC in which the interface endpoint is used.

parameters.name: EmbedHostDomains
parameters.description: The domains where AppStream 2.0 streaming sessions can be embedded in an iframe. You must approve the domains that you want to host embedded AppStream 2.0 streaming sessions. (string) --- Specifies a valid domain that can embed AppStream. Valid examples include: ['testorigin.tt---com', 'testingorigin.com.us', 'test.com.us'] Invalid examples include: ['test,com', '.com', 'h*llo.com'. '']

parameters.name: StreamingExperienceSettings
parameters.description: The streaming protocol you want your stack to prefer. This can be UDP or TCP. Currently, UDP is only supported in the Windows native client. PreferredProtocol (string) --- The preferred protocol that you want to use while streaming your application.

nested_params.name: PreferredProtocol
nested_params.description: The preferred protocol that you want to use while streaming your application.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the stack.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the stack.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description to display.

nested_items.name: DisplayName
nested_items.description: The stack name to display.

nested_items.name: CreatedTime
nested_items.description: The time the stack was created.

nested_items.name: StorageConnectors
nested_items.description: The storage connectors to enable.

nested_items.name: ConnectorType
nested_items.description: The type of storage connector.

nested_items.name: ResourceIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ARN of the storage connector.

nested_items.name: Domains
nested_items.description: The names of the domains for the account.
(string) --- GSuite domain for GDrive integration.

nested_items.name: DomainsRequireAdminConsent
nested_items.description: The OneDrive for Business domains where you require admin consent when users try to link their OneDrive account to AppStream 2.0. The attribute can only be specified when ConnectorType=ONE_DRIVE.
(string) --- GSuite domain for GDrive integration.

nested_items.name: RedirectURL
nested_items.description: The URL that users are redirected to after their streaming session ends.

nested_items.name: FeedbackURL
nested_items.description: The URL that users are redirected to after they click the Send Feedback link. If no URL is specified, no Send Feedback link is displayed.

nested_items.name: StackErrors
nested_items.description: The errors for the stack.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: The error code.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: The error message.

nested_items.name: UserSettings
nested_items.description: The actions that are enabled or disabled for users during their streaming sessions. By default these actions are enabled.

nested_items.name: Action
nested_items.description: The action that is enabled or disabled.

nested_items.name: Permission
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the action is enabled or disabled.

nested_items.name: MaximumLength
nested_items.description: Specifies the number of characters that can be copied by end users from the local device to the remote session, and to the local device from the remote session.

nested_items.name: ApplicationSettings
nested_items.description: The persistent application settings for users of the stack.

nested_items.name: Enabled
nested_items.description: Specifies whether persistent application settings are enabled for users during their streaming sessions.

nested_items.name: SettingsGroup
nested_items.description: The path prefix for the S3 bucket where users' persistent application settings are stored.

nested_items.name: S3BucketName
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket where users' persistent application settings are stored. When persistent application settings are enabled for the first time for an account in an AWS Region, an S3 bucket is created. The bucket is unique to the AWS account and the Region.

nested_items.name: AccessEndpoints
nested_items.description: The list of virtual private cloud (VPC) interface endpoint objects. Users of the stack can connect to AppStream 2.0 only through the specified endpoints.

nested_items.name: EndpointType
nested_items.description: The type of interface endpoint.

nested_items.name: VpceId
nested_items.description: The identifier (ID) of the VPC in which the interface endpoint is used.

nested_items.name: EmbedHostDomains
nested_items.description: The domains where AppStream 2.0 streaming sessions can be embedded in an iframe. You must approve the domains that you want to host embedded AppStream 2.0 streaming sessions.

(string) --- Specifies a valid domain that can embed AppStream. Valid examples include: ['testorigin.tt---com', 'testingorigin.com.us', 'test.com.us'] Invalid examples include: ['test,com', '.com', 'h*llo.com'. '']

nested_items.name: StreamingExperienceSettings
nested_items.description: The streaming protocol you want your stack to prefer. This can be UDP or TCP. Currently, UDP is only supported in the Windows native client.

nested_items.name: PreferredProtocol
nested_items.description: The preferred protocol that you want to use while streaming your application.
